content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Extraction System at position (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction system burner inserter at position (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5).
Use-case:
Transfers extracted materials from the remote mining/smelting area toward the production network.

### Copper Cable Factory Interface (around positions (2.5, 17.5) to (1.5, 19.5))
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at position (2.5, 17.5).
– Dedicated burner inserter placed at position (3.5, 17.5) at the interface.
– Assembling machine (assembling-machine-1) at position (1.5, 19.5) with a copper-cable recipe.
Use-case:
Facilitates the conversion of copper plates into copper cables, forming the core production chain for copper cable manufacturing.

### Wooden Chest Belt Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest placed at position (3.5, 15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot.
– An adjacent transport belt segment at position (4.5, 15.5) linking the depot.
– A dedicated depot burner inserter at position (3.5, 14.5) that transfers items from the depot.
Use-case:
Acts as an intermediary drop-off/pickup point to integrate outputs from the extraction system into the production line.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
– Transport Belt Connection to an Incompatible Target
 • Issue: Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine.
 • Resolution: Always add an inserter that inputs items into the steam engine and use that inserter as the target.
 • Occurrences: Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, and 217.

– Wooden Chest Placement Issues
 • Issue: Failure when attempting placement at a distant target position.
  – Resolution: Ensure the player moves close enough to the target position before attempting to place the entity.
 • Issue: Undefined variable error (“target_chest is not defined”).
  – Resolution: Verify that correct variable names are used and that all required variables are defined in scope.
 • Issue: Attempting to place a wooden chest when none is available in the inventory.
  – Resolution: Check inventory contents to confirm that the required item is available prior to placement.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────────
(No utility functions were defined by the agent.)
